DOC.brief_summary: The burden of diabetes is anticipated to grow yet the proportion of adults whose diabetes is controlled is decreasing over time. This project can have a significant public health impact because we are refining and pilot testing a primary-care based intervention aimed at improving patient engagement and function which are critical components of diabetes care and are associated with improved glycemic control, lower disease-related health-care expenditures, and reduced mortality.
DOC.brief_title: Participatory Design of Patient-centered Depression and Diabetes Care
DOC.criteria: 1. 18 years and older 2. a current diagnosis of Type 2 DM 3. HbA1c 7% 4. current prescription for an oral hypoglycemic agent 5. able to communicate in English 6. willing to give informed consent 1. acutely suicidal or psychotic (patients will not be randomized and PI or physician covering for PI will be paged immediately) 2. significant cognitive impairment at baseline (a total score on MiniMental State Examination (MMSE) 21) 3. markedly shortened life expectancy (diagnosis of metastatic cancer, endstage renal disease on dialysis, or NYHA Class III or IV congestive heart failure)
